Do not operate the machine in rain or wet conditions; water entering the machine may increase the risk of electric shock or malfunction that could result in personal injury.
Yes, always wear long trousers when operating the machine.
Do not operate the machine above waist height; this helps prevent unintended cutter or blade contact and enables better control of the machine in unexpected situations.
Yes, ear/hearing protectors are recommended while operating.
Always remove the battery pack from the machine before making any adjustments, cleaning, or maintenance.
Never use metal-reinforced line, wire, or rope; these can break off and become dangerous projectiles.

The line-cutting blade on the guard trims the cutting line to the proper length.
No; use only the EGO blade; using any other brand could result in serious personal injury.
The correct angle for the cutting attachment is parallel to the ground.
Blade thrust is a sudden, violent movement of the machine in any direction when the blade jams or catches on an object.

Move the machine away from the cutting area and release the trigger switch to stop it.
The rotational speed of the trimmer head is controlled with the trigger switch; more pressure on the trigger results in higher speed, less pressure results in lower speed.
Three speed modes
Low speed mode
Press the speed mode button; each press changes the speed mode; speed indicator shows active mode: one light for low, two for medium, three for high; can be set before or during operation.
The machine is working properly.
Yes; when the machine is re-started after a break, the speed mode will return to the previous speed.
Align the battery ribs with the mounting slots in the machine's battery port and slide the battery pack until it snaps into position.

Depress the battery-release button; battery pack will disengage from the latch; grasp and remove the battery pack; be aware of your feet, children, or pets to avoid injury if battery falls; never remove battery at a high location.
Battery charge level of 20% to 100%
Battery charge level of 10% to 20%
Battery charge level of less than 10%
The battery pack charge is nearly depleted and needs to be charged immediately.
The battery-status indicator will glow solid orange; release the trigger and wait until the battery cools down and the indicator turns green, then restart the machine.
The battery pack electronics error; replace the battery pack or contact EGO customer service center.
The machine is overheated; release the trigger and wait until the machine cools down and the speed indicator turns green, then restart the machine.

A flashing orange speed indicator means the machine is overloaded; remove the battery pack, reattach it, restart the machine, and decrease the load by avoiding too long or oversize cutting line or cutting heavy/woody shrubs.
The battery-status indicator and the speed indicator will illuminate when the machine is started or the speed mode button is pressed.

Lightly tap the trimmer head on the ground while operating the trimmer to release more cutting line.
Tap the trimmer head on bare ground or hard soil for best line release.
Do not remove or alter the line-cutting blade assembly; excessive line length will cause the motor to overheat and may result in serious personal injury.
Cut one piece of cutting line 26 ft. (8 m) long.
approximately 6 in. (15.3 cm) of line should be showing on each side
The spring must be in its original position in the lower cover assembly.
a distinct click sound
Cut by working from top to bottom in small increments to avoid premature line wear or motor drag
Yes; wire and picket fences can cause extra cutting line wear or breakage.
Avoid trimming when grass and weeds are wet.
Always keep the trimming line fully extended; line release becomes more difficult as the cutting line becomes shorter.
Remove the battery and pull the lines while alternately pressing down on and releasing the bump head.

Move the trimmer slowly into and out of the area being cut, maintaining the cutting head position at the desired cutting height; this movement can be either forward-backward or side-to-side.
Yes; use EGO kit ABB1203-1 to replace the trimmer head with a metal blade, replace the guard, and install the Safety Barrier Bar.
Replace the string trimmer head with a metal blade; replace the string trimmer guard with the brush cutter guard; install the Safety Barrier Bar.
Rotate the trimmer head to align the slot in the flange with the shaft-locking hole in the gear case and insert the provided hex key into the aligned holes to act as a stabilizer.
Rotate the trimmer head CLOCKWISE to remove it.
Keep the sheath in a safe place for future use.

Use the left side of the blade to avoid blade thrust situations.
Do not use the cutting attachment above waist height
EGO blade
Approach the weeds being cut with the brush cutter from the right to the left; use the left side of the blade when cutting young stands or woody materials up to 3/4 in (2 cm) in diameter.
No; never use water to clean the trimmer
Use a small brush or a vacuum cleaner to clean the air vents on the rear housing; keep the air vents free of obstructions.
Check the gear case grease level approximately every 50 hours of operation.
Fill with gear grease to 3/4 capacity; do not completely fill the transmission gear case.

Use a fine-tooth file or sharpening stone to sharpen the line-cutting blade.
Tighten the trimmer head onto the shaft COUNTERCLOCKWISE.

Check for damaged/worn parts; ensure the battery pack is connected; ensure the switch is in the correct position; check if the machine can be controlled with the switch.
Remove the battery pack and cool the battery pack until the temperature drops below 152°F (67°C)
Remove the battery pack and cool the string trimmer until the temperature drops below 176°F (80°C)
Remove the battery pack and restart the machine; decrease the load on the machine; avoid too long or oversize cutting line or cutting of heavy/woody shrubs.

Replace with a new lower cover; refer to chapter 'RELOADING THE CUTTING LINE'.
Stop the string trimmer, remove the battery and then clean the drive shaft or the trimmer head thoroughly.
Remove the battery, reload the cutting line, follow the section 'LINE REPLACEMENT' in this manual.
Cut tall grass from the top down, removing no more than 8 inches (20 cm) in each pass to prevent wrapping.
